summary: An Ordinance repealing Ordinance No. 6972, entitled "An Ordinance providing for the improvement of Rainier Avenue, from Jackson Street to Atlantic Street, and Dearborn Street, from Rainier Avenue to Seventeenth Avenue South and Seventeenth Avenue South to Judkins Street, and thence east on Judkins Street to Twentieth Avenue South, in the City of Seattle, by laying a water main of proper dimensions in said portion of said streets and avenues, together with all the necessary gates, tees, crosses, fire hydrants and other appurtenances, which may be necessary for the reasonable water service and fire protection of said portion of said streets and avenues, and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Payment by Bonds," as provided by an act of the Legislature of the State of Washington, entitled "An act authorizing the issuance and sale of bonds by cities, to pay for local improvements, providing for the payment thereof, and declaring an emergency," approved March 14, 1899, and Ordinance No. 5693 said city, approved December 6, 1899."
